text: Vladimir Iosifovich Kondrashov (, 1909-1971) was a Russian mathematician most well known for proving the Rellich–Kondrachov theorem that shows that the embedding of certain Sobolev spaces into Lp spaces is compact. His name has also been transliterated as V.I. Kondrachoff, W. Kondrachov, or V.I. Kondrašov. == Life == Kondrashow was born on in Moscow. He graduated with a PhD from Moscow State University under the supervision of Sergei Sobolev in 1941. As a postdoc at Steklov Institute, where he obtained a DSc in 1950, he organised the Moscow Seminar on the Theory of Functions of Several Variables. For the final 20 years of his life until his death on 26 February 1971, he worked at the Moscow Engineering and Physics Institute. == References == == External links == * *Photo of Kondrashov Category:1909 births Category:1971 deaths Category:20th-century Russian mathematicians Category:People from Moscow Category:Moscow State University alumni Category:Moscow Engineering Physics Institute Category:Place of birth missing
title: Vladimir Iosifovich Kondrashov
